comments.author: Snacky Pants
comments.content: Well, more like 50 minutes, but it was really yummy!

comments.author: Tofu Mom
comments.content:
Wow that looks yummy! How do you get the perfect grill marks? And what brand of tofu? Color me jealous.

I have good luck with grilling tofu and having it taste good, but not so much with it being picture-worthy...

Though maybe it'll be OK if I just title my dish "Scrambled Tofu with Lemongrass Corn Saute and..."

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I usually end up with Island Spring or the Whole Foods house brand of tofu. The keys are to buy *extra firm*, make sure to get the latest expiration date possible, and dry each slice before oiling it and grilling.

comments.author: Cassie Young
comments.content: Looks delicious and very summery!  Very nice.  :)

comments.author: Nari
comments.content: This is actually the perfect thing for all the veggies I have in my fridge+ what I bought two days back. I am lucky that I found it with the terms quinoa lemongrass and an eye for color pics!! thanks for reading my mind several days before my mind thought of a lemongrass based dish!!

comments.author: Karen
comments.content: I don't get to use quinoa enough even though I love it. It's such a cute little grain. :-) This recipe was really beautiful, tasty, and super easy to make. Thanks again for another really yummy recipe to add to my collection!

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Fantastic!  Just did the dishes and already thinking about making again.  :)  Used part patty-pan squash, cooked quinoa in mushroom broth.  Pan-fried the tofu which was not quite as good, but mixed it in with the vegs and was great--another herbivoracious success, thanks!

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: PS.  The tip on rinsing the quinoa really did help, thanks.  Ate leftovers for lunch today and two people asked for the recipe, it smelled so good!
